page.title: 01THE MORRIS MARKOWE UNIT
page.content: { The Morris Markowe Unit}is in New Malden on the south side of Kingston Road. It is also called New Malden Annexe. The hospital caters for 161 psycho-geriatric patients. The building was built in Victorian times and could have been a work house. The hospital was named after the last Superintendent. The oldest patient is 103 years old. Most of the patients are over 40 years of age. The Annexe is not the main hospital,which is Springfield Hospital in Tooting. Patients are allowed to go outside the hospital occasionally,providing they ask permission first. In the garden there are lots of flowers and trees. Each patient has their own room.
